body:
1.8 support in here !

What needs to be done : 

- Client has been entirely untested right now.
- Server is somewhat tested, I know that server_helloworld.js works. 
- Need to check if unit tests pass
- And obviously, need to add acknowledgements in the README : big thanks to @wtfaremyinitials

comment_data.body: I'll go through the things for the PR to be complete tomorrow (checking the unit tests and examples, and finishing the readme). If everything works flawlessly, I'll pull the PR and create a new version on NPM
Awesome

It seems that the client side is completely broken. From what I've gathered, it looks like it never transitions from the `login` state to the `play` state. Where is this supposed to happen? (@roblabla)
https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/master/index.js#L336 there ?

That's half-normal. The "connect" event is emitted when the client actually completes a connection with the server, before any packets is sent.  What you should do is listen for the 'state' event, which is emitted each time there is a state change. That should give you more conclusive evidence. Also, you should run the client with ```NODE_DEBUG=mc-proto node examples/client_echo.js```. This will give you a lot of useful information about which packets are read and written.

```bash
$ NODE_DEBUG=mc-proto node examples/client_echo.js 
MC-PROTO: 43473 Old-styling packet
MC-PROTO: 43473 writing packetId handshaking.set_protocol (0x0)
MC-PROTO: 43473 { protocolVersion: 47,
  serverHost: 'localhost',
  serverPort: 25565,
  nextState: 2 }
MC-PROTO: 43473 <Buffer 0f 00 2f 09 6c 6f 63 61 6c 68 6f 73 74 63 dd 02>
login
MC-PROTO: 43473 Old-styling packet
MC-PROTO: 43473 writing packetId login.login_start (0x0)
MC-PROTO: 43473 { username: 'Player' }
MC-PROTO: 43473 <Buffer 08 00 06 50 6c 61 79 65 72>
MC-PROTO: 43473 read packetId login.compress (0x3)
MC-PROTO: 43473 { id: 3, threshold: 256 }
```

node cleanly exits after reading the 0x03 login compression packet.
Just confirmed, onLogin never gets called.
Looks like reading compressed packets never got implemented, so everything after 0x03 (set compression) gets dropped. Since 0x02 (login) is sent *after* 0x03, the login is never received.
I guess parsePacket needs to become async, unless we find a lib that has sync zlib.
@wtfaremyinitials We shouldn't try to make it sync if it involves IO. Making it async shouldn't be too much work anyway.
@roblabla The parse function is in a `while` loop, so making it work asynchronously will break almost everything. I agree though, we should try to make it async.
My async parseNewStylePacket is pushed to [packets-1.8](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/tree/packets-1.8). I have to go right now, but you're welcome to finish that off.

Doesn't really matter too much that it's in a while loop, all we need to do is make the function call itself again in the callback until we meet a terminal condition, effectively turning the whole thing recursive. I'll try finishing it off.

I just finished turning the whole thing recursive, but it seems to not work properly. The client connects, doesn't fire any chat events, then cleanly exits after about 10 seconds. ([packets-1.8](https://github.com/wtfaremyinitials/node-minecraft-protocol/tree/packets-1.8))
Did you ever figure this out? @roblabla

Well, I'm almost done, but the damn thing is entering an infinite recursion and leaking memory until it ooms my machine. Then stuff happened and I sorta never found the time to do this. I'll take a look right now.
Well I debugged that one. Now, for some reason, ```crypto.randomBytes``` never calls my callback. I'm going from hurdle to hurdle here.
Huh that's odd. Can you push a version to roblabla/node-minecraft-protocol that has this issue? I'd be happy to look at it.

@wtfaremyinitials Done. looking at the results of the top command, it looks like the code enters an infinite loop or something, cpu goes to 100%... I don't have any debuggers though, so it's rough debugging that.
After looking at my code long enough in a mean way, I found the culprit for this bug. Now we've got... another bug. Pushing new code.
I never seem to read the Login packet the server is supposed to send me now. I'm debugging using the ``example/client_chat.js``. I'm giving up for now, I need to take a break.
What bug did you find?

@JavaPortals Somehow, the login packet the server sends is never read, no idea why. Could be an infinite loop, or any other kind of bugs. I need to setup myself a proper debugging environment (currently using io.js instead of node.js, which is incompatible with most debuggers out there...). If you find something, please do tell me :D
I'll see what I can do
Should now be working, for the most part. I'll write a quick-n-dirty proxy and use it to test out all the packets in practice.
This should make the protocol 100% complete. Only tests are missing, then I'll squash the commits so only one remains.
Should be ready to merge.

```js
will@arya node-minecraft-protocol(review-108) $ node examples/proxy.js 

/Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/examples/proxy.js:85
      console.log(`client<-server: Error in packetId ${state}.0x${packetId.val
                  ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token ILLEGAL
```

```js
will@arya node-minecraft-protocol(review-108) $ mocha
Beginning write test
Finished write test in 4.145 seconds

buffer.js:784
    throw TypeError('value is out of bounds');
          ^
TypeError: value is out of bounds
    at TypeError (<anonymous>)
    at checkInt (buffer.js:784:11)
    at Buffer.writeInt8 (buffer.js:892:5)
    at Array.writeByte [as 1] (/Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/lib/protocol.js:1190:10)
    at write (/Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/lib/protocol.js:1430:17)
    at /Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/lib/protocol.js:1489:14
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at createPacketBuffer (/Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/lib/protocol.js:1484:10)
    at Client.write (/Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/lib/client.js:199:16)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/will/Projects/node-minecraft-protocol/test/benchmark.js:49:10)
```

Woot :smile:

title: Packets 1.8
